title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 332.8 - Voter who has not yet filed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 332.8 - Voter who has not yet filed

State Regulations
(a) A
military voter who has not filed an application, or having filed an application
has not received a military ballot, and who is honorably discharged subsequent
to October 1, 1976, may have his name entered in the register of voters or on
the registration records by personally filing an application with the board of
elections of the county of his residence before noon of November 2, 1976. (b) A qualified voter who
shall have been inducted into or who shall have enlisted in the armed forces
and who shall not have taken his oath of allegiance prior to October 21, 1976, may sign an application as provided in subdivisions 8 and 9 of section 305 and
shall file the same with the board of elections of his home county of residence
on or before noon of the Monday prior to election day, provided he shall
thereafter, on or before election day, become a member of the armed
forces. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
332.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
